intro: Lithospermum altamiranense, commonly known as the Altamira rock pepper, is a perennial herb native to Brazil. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum altamiranense thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
